data_findings.finding: This is a 2D bin packing optimization problem: pack Christmas tree shapes (15-vertex polygons) into smallest square bounding box for N=1 to 200 trees. Score = sum of (side^2/N) for all N. Lower is better.
Key tool: bbox3 binary - external optimizer that takes -n (iterations) and -r (rounds) parameters. Used by top kernels for optimization. Example: ./bbox3 -n 1000 -r 96

fix_direction technique: Optimize rotation angle of entire configuration to minimize bounding box. Uses scipy.optimize.minimize_scalar on convex hull points. Can improve score by rotating all trees together.
Overlap repair strategy: After optimization, check for overlapping trees and replace invalid configurations with known-good ones from a donor file. Use STRtree for efficient collision detection.

C++ optimizer (Santa Claude): Uses simulated annealing, local search, compaction, squeeze operations. Multi-threaded with OpenMP. Includes swap moves, multi-angle restarts, boundary tree optimization.
Backward propagation technique: Start from N=200 and work backwards, removing boundary-touching trees to potentially improve smaller N configurations.
